hook.text: Rio de Janeiro's Carnival draws two million people per day to the streets for five days of nonstop dancing.

buildup.text: Samba schools spend the entire year preparing elaborate costumes and choreography for the parade.

discovery.text: The Sambadrome, a purpose-built parade avenue, holds 90,000 spectators watching schools compete.

twist.text: Carnival dates back to Portuguese colonial times. It blended European Lent traditions with African rhythms.

climax.text: The event generates $2 billion for Rio's economy. Winning samba schools gain celebrity-level fame.

punchline.text: Five days of dancing powers a city's entire year.

quiz.question: How many people attend Rio's Carnival daily?
